intro: Anthericopsis sepalosa, commonly known as the sepalose anthericopsis, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, featuring small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and have a slightly hairy surface, while the stem is often slender and branched. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant but poorly understood species.
